text: Daniel Defert (born 10 September 1937 died 7 February 2023) is a French sociologist and HIV/AIDS activist. He was a partner to academic Michel Foucault. Defert co-founded France's first AIDS advocacy group, AIDES, after Foucault's death from the disease. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:French sociologists Category:HIV/AIDS activists Category:French LGBT people Category:LGBT scientists Category:Gay men Category:French health activists
title: Daniel Defert
